channel.title: Restore old user account?
channel.description: I was trying to do something on a friends computer and screwed it up. A new user was created with the same name, however it is located at JohnDoe.Aspire3690, instead of JohnDoe. I tried to copy over the files frm JohnDoe to the new folder however this leads me to get errors when trying to run explorer.exe from within this account. It works from within safe mode, but without it I don't really know what to do. The OS is windows 7 and I ran a program that was meant to change the SID, but it stalled part way through. Is there anything I can do to restore the old user? Sorry this is a bit jumbled in a hurry edit: maybe in safemode its the original account? the pinned taskbar icons are the same

item.title: Restore old user account?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I tried that, it gave me more shit. I decided to just make a new user account and transfer over what I could.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore old user account?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Use a Linux distribution to copy the files over maybe, don’t have problems with Windows’ security and all then.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore old user account?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Thanks I haven’t been able to either. I’m trying something about fixing corrupted user profiles but so far no luck.
EDIT: That didn’t work. Something else of note is that when I try to log in through regular windows, as soon as I hit enter after the password it tells me it’s logging off. However in safe mode it loads and works just fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore old user account?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

cooper:

The problem is that they both have the same username (JohnDoe), and when I try to log into the new one it redirects to the other directory. I only do see one JohnDoe though.

I tried finding an answer to that question but I couldn’t find anything that would constitute a good answer…

Read full topic

item.title: Restore old user account?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

The problem is that they both have the same username (JohnDoe), and when I try to log into the new one it redirects to the other directory. I only do see one JohnDoe though.

item.title: Restore old user account?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Can you see the account on startup when you choose which account to log into?

Read full topic

item.title: Restore old user account?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Thanks Newty, but that’s not so much it… the files still exist, it’s just I don’t have access to the account for some reason. C:\Users\JohnDoe (location of original account) is still accessible, just when windows is booted into normally i can’t log in to that account. However in safe mode, it is what I am logged into (I tested this by deleting JohnDoe.Asire3690, and found that I still have access to the previously made documents.)

Read full topic

item.title: Restore old user account?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

http://www.sevenforums.com/chillout-room/61037-recover-deleted-data-deleted-user-account.html

Notably:

You can get programs which will attempt to recover your deleted files.

Here is a link to one:
Recuva - Undelete, Unerase, File and Disk Recovery - Free Download
This is made by the guys who make CCleaner.

I haven’t tried Recuva, I use a program called Pandora Recovery.
If you haven’t added too many files or defragged your HDD, you might be able to get most of your files back. Good Luck!

Read full topic

item.title: Restore old user account?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I was trying to do something on a friends computer and screwed it up.
A new user was created with the same name, however it is located at JohnDoe.Aspire3690, instead of JohnDoe. I tried to copy over the files frm JohnDoe to the new folder however this leads me to get errors when trying to run explorer.exe from within this account. It works from within safe mode, but without it I don’t really know what to do. The OS is windows 7 and I ran a program that was meant to change the SID, but it stalled part way through. Is there anything I can do to restore the old user? Sorry this is a bit jumbled in a hurry
edit: maybe in safemode its the original account? the pinned taskbar icons are the same

Read full topic
